enWisdom: Excessiveness in joking is foolishness
Joking is a [cause of] separation that is followed by rancour

Wisdom: إِيَّاكَ أَنْ تَذْكُرَ مِنَ الْكَلَامِ مُضْحِكاً وَإِنْ حَكَيْتَهُ عَنْ غَيْرِكَ
enWisdom: Beware of recalling that which was funny in the speech [of others], even if you narrate it from someone else
The bane of awe is jest
The best [form of] laughter is a smile
Abandon [excessive] joking for indeed it is the conception of rancour

Wisdom: كَفَى بِالْمَرْءِ جَهْلًا أَنْ يَضْحَكَ مِنْ غَيْرِ عَجَبٍ
enWisdom: It suffices as ignorance for a person to laugh without [a reason for] amusement
The excessive laughter of a man corrupts his dignity
Too much joking diminishes one’s reverence [and dignity]

Wisdom: كَثْرَةُ الضَّحِكِ تُوحِشُ الْجَلِيسَ وَتَشِينُ الرَّئِيسَ
enWisdom: Excessive laughter alienates the companion and disgraces the leader

Wisdom: كَثْرَةُ الْمِزَاحِ تُذْهِبُ الْبَهَاءَ وَيُوجِبُ الشَّحْنَاءَ
enWisdom: Too much joking takes away prestige and brings about enmity [and rancour]
One who jokes [excessively] is taken lightly
One whose laughter increases, his reverence decreases
One whose joking increases is deemed ignorant
One whose laughter increases, his heart dies
One whose joking is excessive is considered a fool
One whose laughs excessively is regarded as being low
Whoever jokes too much is considered ignorant
One whose joking increases, his dignity diminishes
One whose joking increases, his reverence [and dignity] decreases

Wisdom: مَنْ جَعَلَ دَيْدَنَهُ الْهَزْلَ لَمْ يُعْرَفْ جِدُّهُ
enWisdom: Whoever makes jesting his habit, his seriousness is not known
Whoever jokes a lot, his seriousness becomes ineffective [and is considered just another of his jokes]

Wisdom: مَنْ غَلَبَ عَلَيْهِ الْهَزْلُ فَسَدَ عَقْلُهُ
enWisdom: Whoever is overcome by jest, his intellect becomes corrupt

Wisdom: مَنْ كَثُرَ مِزَاحُهُ لَمْ يَخْلُ مِنْ حَاقِدٍ عَلَيْهِ وَمُسْتَخِفٍّ بِهِ
enWisdom: Whoever jokes excessively will never be without one who bears a grudge against him and one who takes him lightly

Wisdom: مَا مَزَحَ امْرُؤٌ مَزْحَةً إِلَّا مَجَّ مِنْ عَقْلِهِ‏ مَجَّةً
enWisdom: Any time a person makes a joke, he parts with a portion of his intellect

Wisdom: وَقِّرُوا أَنْفُسَكُمْ عَنِ الْفُكَاهَاتِ وَمَضَاحِكِ الْحِكَايَاتِ وَمَحَالِّ التُّرَّهَاتِ
enWisdom: Maintain your self-respect by keeping away from jokes, funny narrations and useless speech
Do not make fun of a noble person such that he ends up bearing a grudge against you

Wisdom: لَا تُمَازِحَنَّ صَدِيقاً فَيُعَادِيَكَ وَلَا عَدُوّاً فَيُرْدِيَكَ
enWisdom: Never make fun of a friend thereby turning him into an enemy, or of an enemy thereby making him [want to] destroy you

Wisdom: لَا تُكْثِرَنَّ الضَّحِكَ فَتَذْهَبَ هَيْبَتُكَ وَلَا الْمِزَاحَ فَيُسْتَخَفَّ بِكَ
enWisdom: Never laugh too much such that your reverence is lost; and do not joke [too much] thereby [resulting in your] being taken lightly
